Name: Aachen Cathedral . short_description:

Construction of this palatine chapel, with its octagonal basilica and cupola, began c. 790â€“800 under the Emperor Charlemagne. Originally inspired by the churches of the Eastern part of the Holy Roman Empire, it was splendidly enlarged in the Middle Ages.
